org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode

Class FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo
  • Enclosing class:
    FSNamesystem

    public class FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo
extends Object
    SafeModeInfo contains information related to the safe mode.

    An instance of FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo is created when the name node enters safe mode.

    During name node startup FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo counts the number of safe blocks, those that have at least the minimal number of replicas, and calculates the ratio of safe blocks to the total number of blocks in the system, which is the size of blocks in FSNamesystem.blockManager. When the ratio reaches the threshold it starts the SafeModeMonitor daemon in order to monitor whether the safe mode extension is passed. Then it leaves safe mode and destroys itself.

    If safe mode is turned on manually then the number of safe blocks is not tracked because the name node is not intended to leave safe mode automatically in the case.

    See Also:
    ClientProtocol.setSafeMode(HdfsConstants.SafeModeAction, boolean)

      • threshold

        private final double threshold
        Safe mode threshold condition %.

      • datanodeThreshold

        private final int datanodeThreshold
        Safe mode minimum number of datanodes alive

      • extension

        private volatile int extension
        Safe mode extension after the threshold. Make it volatile so that getSafeModeTip can read the latest value without taking a lock.

      • safeReplication

        private final int safeReplication
        Min replication required by safe mode.

      • replQueueThreshold

        private final double replQueueThreshold
        threshold for populating needed replication queues

      • reached

        private long reached
        Time when threshold was reached.
        -1 safe mode is off
        0 safe mode is on, and threshold is not reached yet
        >0 safe mode is on, but we are in extension period

      • reachedTimestamp

        private long reachedTimestamp

      • FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo

        private FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
        Creates SafeModeInfo when the name node enters automatic safe mode at startup.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration

      • FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo

        private FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo(boolean resourcesLow)
        Creates SafeModeInfo when safe mode is entered manually, or because available resources are low. The threshold is set to 1.5 so that it could never be reached. blockTotal is set to -1 to indicate that safe mode is manual.
        See Also:
        FSNamesystem.SafeModeInfo

    • Method Detail

      • shouldIncrementallyTrackBlocks

        private boolean shouldIncrementallyTrackBlocks()
        In the HA case, the StandbyNode can be in safemode while the namespace is modified by the edit log tailer. In this case, the number of total blocks changes as edits are processed (eg blocks are added and deleted). However, we don't want to do the incremental tracking during the startup-time loading process -- only once the initial total has been set after the image has been loaded.

      • isOn

        private boolean isOn()
        Check if safe mode is on.
        Returns:
        true if in safe mode

        Safe mode can be turned off iff the threshold is reached and the extension time have passed.
        Returns:
        true if can leave or false otherwise.

      • needEnter

        private boolean needEnter()
        There is no need to enter safe mode if DFS is empty or threshold == 0
